releaseNotes.description: MBX version 1.2 has been released containing significant performance improvements! When running on many OpenMP threads, your many-body simulations may be up to 3-4x as fast! (depending, of course, on your particular hardware)

changelog: Improved ability to exploit OpenMP parallelism throughout MBX, particularly in the reciprocal space electrostatics and polynomial evaluation.
Reduced number of particles passed from LAMMPS interface to real space dispersion.

releaseNotes.description: MBX version 1.1 has been released containing significant performance improvements, specifically in the real-space electrostatics part of the PEF.

changelog: Significant performance improvements to the real-space electrostatics part of the PEF.
Added bin/mb_decomp executable, generated by make install when compiling stand-alone MBX. This executable can be used to perform many-body decomposition of input structures.
